newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan share prices seen consolidating.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan share prices seen consolidating.

text.p: Taiwan share prices are expected to consolidate on Monday as investors remain on the sidelines amid political uncertainties, brokers said.
On Saturday, the weighted index closed 40.82 points or 0.50 percent higher to 8,274.19 points.

Recent political uncertainties, including a planned cabinet reshuffle on Wednesday and the opposition parties' plan to demand that President Lee Teng-hui name a new premier, would dominate market sentiment, brokers said.
"Domestic political situation is quite uncertain at the moment, so is the stock market," said Amy Huang, an analyst of Nomura Securities.
But brokers said they did not expect a sharp fall as government-related funds would likely to buy stocks at low levels.
A range of 8,150-8,350 was seen for Monday.
